snippet: The new measures, more limited than those announced last month by the United States, will freeze assets in Japan of groups and individuals involved in Russia’s intervention in Ukraine.
abstract: Japan imposes new round of sanctions on Russia; measures, more limited than those ordered by the United States, will freeze assets in Japan of groups and individuals connected with Russia's involvement in Ukraine; analysts call measures largely symbolic and an indication of Prime Min Shinzo Abe's desire to maintain diplomatic relations with Russia while falling in line with his country's most important ally.

byline.contributor: Neil MacFarquhar contributed reporting from Moscow.

lead_paragraph: The new measures, more limited than those announced last month by the United States, will freeze assets in Japan of groups and individuals involved in Russia’s intervention in Ukraine.

headline.main: Japan Imposes New Sanctions on Russia but Keeps a Diplomatic Door Open
headline.print_headline: Japan Imposes New Sanctions on Russia but Keeps a Diplomatic Door Open
